instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3535: What is 820-3535? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3535</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Finstack fault TH1H
threads.message: No liquid ingress known. Fans run high. ASD shows TH1H below limit but when I check FINSTACKSNS_ALERT_L, it always reads 3.3V with or without the IO cable connected. I've tried 3 different IO cables and IO boards. DIode reading at pin 21 J9500 = .53. Replaced the SMC twice and checked for continuity from <RESISTOR>R5172</RESISTOR> to corresponding pad 123 under SMC. I get 3v3 at TP SMC SENSOR ALERT. I'm at a loss as to what is causing this fault.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3535</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Finstack fault TH1H
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3535</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Finstack fault TH1H
threads.message: Tried those and was hopeful but: Still getting fault.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3535</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Finstack fault TH1H
threads.message:
A signal like <SIGNAL>ALERT_L</SIGNAL> is good to have it high; problem appears if low.
Mentioned signal is active low, remember.

Is that the only error which appers on ASD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3535</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Finstack fault TH1H
threads.message: right. Thats why I thought it was SMC. Could this be PCH issue? Yes that is the only error. I've run ASD probably 5 times and Finstack TH1H is only error.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3535</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Finstack fault TH1H
threads.message:
Did you set continue, instead of stop on first error?

Good trackpad must be connected, as LIO board too.
If not, fan spins to max and error comes up too.

Did you try disconnecting webcam?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3535</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Finstack fault TH1H
threads.message: Correct, ASD set to continue so only the one actual error. Disconnecting webcam didn't change anything

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3535</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Finstack fault TH1H
threads.message:
Check Q/<CAPACITOR>C5830</CAPACITOR> and traces to <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>.
Also check <RESISTOR>R5370</RESISTOR>/71 and their traces to J9500.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3535</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Finstack fault TH1H
threads.message: SOLVEd. Thanks for your help. Had a very high diode reading on pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R5370</RESISTOR> so it was not getting <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL>. Jumpered that and all is well!
